channel.title: Why tutorials are worthless
channel.description:
So, here is a conversation I had with 'Rich on IRC.
HEy Anyone here that can verify my tut? no <@Rich> yes but no Why not, rich? <@Rich> theres 4 pages of unapproved tutorials waiting <@Rich> plus iirc we're just going to let them sit there until we upgrade to 2.0 Well, can you at least make a fucking effort? Why should people spend time writing perfectly good tutorials, when there's no one going to see them ? <@Rich> cos 99.9% of the tutorials posted are shit <@Rich> and id decline them all <@Rich> but we're removing the filter once 2.0 is released Well, can you read my tutorial?
So, if you're thinking of helping people, go somewhere else.

item.title: Why tutorials are worthless
item.dc:creator: @B2300_T4nk B2300 T4nk
item.description:
@B2300_T4nk wrote:

Lol okay.

Read full topic

item.title: Why tutorials are worthless
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

[quote=“B2300 T4nk, post:56, topic:309691”][quote author=Tico link=topic=406136.msg3004050#msg3004050 date=1256241982]

I think… That… This is all good stuff. But I think it would be much nicer if we just banned Adam. I mean I personally think most of the staff on here are doing their jobs fantastically. All I saw from Adam was abuse directed at this website and it’s staff so if he thinks it’s so crap why doesn’t he just leave?

It’s impossible to leave, just let him stay and if he gets banned for his actions, so be it.

And @Newty nice quote.

Heh, I banned him anyway.

Also:

@ranger squad:

Reccomending yourself is a sure fire way to guarentee you will never get a staff position here.

This is almost entirely accurate, but that’s not to say we haven’t done it before.

[/quote] So you say that someone from the staff said that and got a position?[/quote]

Sorry, I don’t know what I was thinking, I meant it’s not to say we won’t ever do it in the future.

Read full topic

item.title: Why tutorials are worthless
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:41, topic:309691”][/quote]The requirements to become a moderator are pretty high on the expectation ladder. There’s more than just “online time” and “java knowledge” that the senior staff takes into account.

[ul][]Online Time
[]Contribution/dedication to the community
[]thread/post value
[]logic/ethic in reasoning
[]previous servitudes (evaluation of previous judgment ie. warnings, moderation, etc.)
[]The ability to make unbiased decisions, let alone decisions not of your opinon
[*]Experience as a person. (maturity)[/ul]

There’s much more as well. Everything about your profile and how you go about yourself throughout the community is evaluated.
[/quote]

Great way to put it, that is almost exactly what we look at.

@ranger squad:

Reccomending yourself is a sure fire way to guarentee you will never get a staff position here.

Read full topic

item.title: Why tutorials are worthless
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Ah, I see.
That also.

I actually meant it in a different way, the key to a good mod is patience, you have to be patient with more ‘nooby’ members of the community to help them, etc etc.
And, gotta be patient if you’re really going for mod, I mean, I never expected myself to become one, came as a complete surprise. But I never went around posting this. :rolleyes:

[quote=“ranger squad, post:39, topic:309691”][quote author=ranger squad link=topic=406136.msg3002872#msg3002872 date=1256152222]
I can do better. I am online most of the day, all day at weekends, and I have an all right knwoledge in java.
[/quote][/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Why tutorials are worthless
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

SilentCJ:

I think the key is patience.

Which is what I said as my first post of this topic ;).

[quote=“Primadude, post:5, topic:309691”]Just be patient.

The staff can’t be online 24/7. I’m sure there will be at least one member of staff on at any point in the day, but they also have other things to deal with/moderate.[/quote]

Read full topic

[/quote][/quote]

As Mitb and Tico said, you don’t need to be fluent in the language of Java, or any programming language, to be a moderator/member of staff.

item.title: Why tutorials are worthless
item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

[quote=“Adam, post:38, topic:309691”][quote author=Tico link=topic=406136.msg3002867#msg3002867 date=1256151978]
To moderate? I’ve already said it once, programming ability and moderation ability are at two different ends of the table; you don’t have to be fluent in a programming language to be a moderator.

@Chaos: If you think others can do better, then by all means say who.
[/quote]
Hence you Tico.

This isn’t a discussion topic for a start, i’s just someone having a rant.

The original topic wasn’t but if you payed any attention, you’d realize that it turned into a discussion.

/mopar morons…
[center] There is no need for ignorant replies.[/center][br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 21, 2009, 01:38:42 pm[/size][hr]^ This is why moderation powers should not be put into the hands of someone who is just barely old enough to play RuneScape.
[center] Get lost.[/center][/quote]
sorry for the ignorant reply, but it seems i probably read the topic in more detail than you, consiering this topic has nothing worth discussing and if you think, discussing the moderators ability to moderate is discussion… and it’s hardly worth discussing the efficiency of the moderators, they don’t need people like you slowing them down, i think they have enough to deal with than a few crappy tutorails.

Read full topic

I can do better. I am online most of the day, all day at weekends, and I have an all right knwoledge in java.
[/quote][/quote]The requirements to become a moderator are pretty high on the expectation ladder. There’s more than just “online time” and “java knowledge” that the senior staff takes into account.

[ul][]Online Time
[]Contribution/dedication to the community
[]thread/post value
[]logic/ethic in reasoning
[]previous servitudes (evaluation of previous judgment ie. warnings, moderation, etc.)
[]The ability to make unbiased decisions, let alone decisions not of your opinon
[*]Experience as a person. (maturity)[/ul]

There’s much more as well. Everything about your profile and how you go about yourself throughout the community is evaluated.

Read full topic

item.title: Why tutorials are worthless
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

99 percent of the currently approved tutorials shouldn’t be there.

That means that there wouldn’t be any tutorials left, since there aren’t 100 approved tutorials yet.

@ranger squad: What’s wrong with what Rich stated on IRC? If the tutorial is shit, then it will be declined. If you spend 3 hours on a tutorial and it’s shit, don’t expect it to be approved by Rich or another moderator. And what’s wrong with Rich’s explanation of why tutorials aren’t getting approved:

<@Rich> plus iirc we're just going to let them sit there until we upgrade to 2.0

What’s wrong with that? You can just submit it when the upgrade is complete. Furthermore:

<@Rich> but we're removing the filter once 2.0 is released

Submit it when the filter is removed and stop bitching.

Read full topic

item.title: Why tutorials are worthless
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

[quote=“Adam, post:24, topic:309691”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=406136.msg3002420#msg3002420 date=1256102015]
99 percent of the currently approved tutorials shouldn’t be there.
[/quote]
this.

Contrary to some people’s belief, it does not take a programmer to make a good moderator. In fact, many times a good programmer is not a good moderator. But in the strange case of moderators approving programming tutorials, they must have at least a working knowledge of programming in order to do so. Therefore there is a limited number moderators that can actually approve the tutorials.

What’s the point of having a moderator who cannot contribute to a community based off of (shit)programming?[/quote]

To moderate? I’ve already said it once, programming ability and moderation ability are at two different ends of the table; you don’t have to be fluent in a programming language to be a moderator.

@Chaos: If you think others can do better, then by all means say who.

Read full topic

item.title: Why tutorials are worthless
item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

[quote=“Adam, post:34, topic:309691”][quote author=Jordiescape link=topic=406136.msg3002794#msg3002794 date=1256148430]

On the bottom line: Most moderators which are capable of approving tutorial are way too busy. Then whenever they do get the time to make some approvals they are faced with pages of shit which makes it harder to sift out the really good and educational tutorials.

@Adam:
I would not say I was pro at programming however I still moderate. They are both completely different jobs, the opposite in fact. Programming is more orientated towards logic and absolutes while moderating involves assessing situations and making unique decisions.

ps: access to unapproved tutorials please

I’m talking about allowing moderators to approve tutorials on a site based on (shit)programming, when they have little to no experience with a programming language.

99 percent of the currently approved tutorials shouldn’t be there.

this.

Contrary to some people’s belief, it does not take a programmer to make a good moderator. In fact, many times a good programmer is not a good moderator. But in the strange case of moderators approving programming tutorials, they must have at least a working knowledge of programming in order to do so. Therefore there is a limited number moderators that can actually approve the tutorials.

What’s the point of having a moderator who cannot contribute to a community based off of (shit)programming?

To moderate.

You sir, are a moron.

Moderators are 4 moderating
[/quote]
My point was; If you’re going to join a discussion, at least say something meaningful. Don’t just troll.[/quote]

This isn’t a discussion topic for a start, i’s just someone having a rant.

Read full topic

[/quote]
